subtasks.details:
Define RLS policies in SQL editor to control data access based on user roles
<info added on 2025-06-17T06:52:22.411Z>
# Row Level Security (RLS) Implementation

## Implemented RLS Policies

### 1. notices Table Policies
- "Anyone can read published notices": Only published notices are visible to all users
- "Authenticated users can manage notices": Authenticated users can perform all management operations

### 2. inquiries Table Policies
- "Anyone can create inquiries": All users can create inquiry entries
- "Only authenticated users can read inquiries": Only administrators can view inquiries
- "Only authenticated users can update inquiries": Only administrators can modify inquiries

## Security Testing
- Created test API endpoint (/api/test-rls) to verify policy enforcement
- Published notices test: ✅ Only returns 2 published notices (1 unpublished hidden)
- Inquiries access test: ✅ Anonymous users receive 0 results (security enforced)
- Inquiry creation test: ✅ Successfully created by anonymous users

## Security Features
- Privacy protection: Inquiries viewable only by administrators
- Content control: Unpublished notices automatically hidden
- Accessibility: Anyone can submit inquiries

## Documentation
- Created docs/rls-policies.md with detailed policy explanations
- Included test results and implementation details

All RLS policies verified and functioning as intended, ensuring proper data security.
</info added on 2025-06-17T06:52:22.411Z>

subtasks.details: Use JWT or session-based authentication. Implement login, logout, and password reset functionality.

subtasks.title: Create API routes for inquiry management
subtasks.description: Develop backend API routes for listing, viewing, and responding to inquiries.
subtasks.details: Implement GET, POST, and PUT routes for inquiries. Include pagination and filtering options for the listing route.

subtasks.title: Set up database schema and interactions
subtasks.description: Design and implement the database schema for storing inquiries and responses.
subtasks.details: Use an ORM like Sequelize or TypeORM to define models and handle database interactions. Include fields for inquiry details, status, and response data.

subtasks.title: Develop inquiry listing page
subtasks.description: Create a frontend page to display a list of inquiries with sorting and filtering options.
subtasks.details: Implement a table or grid view with pagination. Include search functionality and status filters.

subtasks.title: Implement inquiry detail view
subtasks.description: Create a page to display detailed information about a single inquiry and allow admin responses.
subtasks.details: Show all inquiry details, including user information and inquiry history. Implement a form for admin responses.

subtasks.title: Add response functionality
subtasks.description: Implement the ability for admins to respond to inquiries and update their status.
subtasks.details: Create a form for composing responses. Implement status updates (e.g., pending, in progress, resolved). Add email notification functionality for user updates.

tasks.title: Implement Real-time Updates for Inquiries
tasks.description: Add real-time functionality for new inquiries using Supabase Realtime.
tasks.details: Set up Supabase Realtime subscription for the inquiries table. Implement real-time updates in the admin dashboard to show new inquiries without page refresh. Use Supabase's subscription API to listen for changes.
tasks.testStrategy: Test real-time updates by submitting new inquiries and verifying immediate appearance in the admin dashboard. Check for any performance issues related to real-time subscriptions.

subtasks.title: Set up Supabase Realtime
subtasks.description: Configure Supabase project settings to enable Realtime functionality
subtasks.details: Enable Realtime in Supabase dashboard, configure security rules, and set up necessary tables for real-time updates

subtasks.title: Implement subscription logic
subtasks.description: Create subscription handlers to listen for real-time updates
subtasks.details: Use Supabase client to subscribe to specific tables or channels, implement error handling and reconnection logic

subtasks.title: Create UI update mechanism
subtasks.description: Develop a system to efficiently update the UI with real-time data
subtasks.details: Implement a state management solution (e.g., Redux, MobX) to handle real-time updates and trigger UI re-renders

subtasks.title: Optimize performance
subtasks.description: Ensure efficient handling of real-time updates without impacting app performance
subtasks.details: Implement debouncing, throttling, or batching techniques to prevent excessive UI updates, optimize React component rendering

subtasks.title: Test and debug real-time functionality
subtasks.description: Thoroughly test the real-time features and fix any issues
subtasks.details: Create test scenarios for various real-time update scenarios, implement logging for debugging, and ensure proper error handling

tasks.title: Optimize Performance and Implement SEO
tasks.description: Optimize the application for performance and implement basic SEO.
tasks.details: Implement image optimization using Next.js Image component. Add meta tags for SEO using Next.js Head component. Implement lazy loading for non-critical components. Use Next.js dynamic imports for code splitting where appropriate.
tasks.testStrategy: Run Lighthouse audits to measure performance, accessibility, and SEO scores. Verify that images are properly optimized and lazy loaded. Check that meta tags are correctly set for each page.

subtasks.title: Analyze current website performance
subtasks.description: Use tools like Lighthouse or PageSpeed Insights to measure current website performance metrics
subtasks.details: Record baseline metrics for page load time, First Contentful Paint, and Time to Interactive

subtasks.title: Optimize image assets
subtasks.description: Compress and resize images to reduce file sizes without compromising quality
subtasks.details: Use tools like ImageOptim or Squoosh to optimize images, consider implementing WebP format

subtasks.title: Implement lazy loading for images
subtasks.description: Add lazy loading attributes to images to defer loading of off-screen images
subtasks.details: Use the 'loading' attribute or Intersection Observer API for lazy loading implementation

subtasks.title: Optimize meta tags for SEO
subtasks.description: Review and update meta tags to improve search engine visibility
subtasks.details: Focus on title tags, meta descriptions, and Open Graph tags for social sharing

subtasks.title: Implement code splitting
subtasks.description: Break down JavaScript bundles into smaller chunks to improve initial load time
subtasks.details: Use dynamic imports or React.lazy() for component-level code splitting

subtasks.title: Optimize CSS delivery
subtasks.description: Minimize CSS, remove unused styles, and optimize CSS delivery
subtasks.details: Use tools like PurgeCSS to remove unused styles, consider critical CSS inlining

subtasks.title: Implement caching strategies
subtasks.description: Set up proper caching headers and implement service workers for offline caching
subtasks.details: Configure server caching headers, implement service worker for asset caching

subtasks.title: Optimize server response time
subtasks.description: Analyze and improve server-side performance to reduce Time to First Byte (TTFB)
subtasks.details: Optimize database queries, implement server-side caching, consider CDN usage

subtasks.title: Conduct final performance testing
subtasks.description: Re-run performance tests and compare with baseline metrics to measure improvements
subtasks.details: Use the same tools as in subtask 1, document improvements, and identify any remaining issues

tasks.title: Implement Responsive Design
tasks.description: Ensure the entire application is fully responsive across all device sizes.
tasks.details: Use Tailwind CSS responsive classes to adjust layouts for different screen sizes. Test and adjust all components and pages for mobile, tablet, and desktop views. Implement a responsive navigation menu that collapses on smaller screens.
tasks.testStrategy: Test the application on various devices and screen sizes. Use browser developer tools to simulate different device sizes and verify layout integrity.

subtasks.title: Define breakpoints for responsive design
subtasks.description: Establish standard breakpoints for mobile, tablet, and desktop views
subtasks.details: Research common breakpoints and decide on specific pixel widths for each device category

subtasks.title: Create responsive layout grid system
subtasks.description: Develop a flexible grid system that adapts to different screen sizes
subtasks.details: Implement a CSS grid or flexbox-based system that adjusts column widths and margins

subtasks.title: Implement responsive navigation menu
subtasks.description: Design and code a navigation menu that collapses on smaller screens
subtasks.details: Create a hamburger menu for mobile and expand to full menu on larger screens

subtasks.title: Optimize images for responsive design
subtasks.description: Prepare and implement responsive images that load appropriately for different screen sizes
subtasks.details: Use srcset and sizes attributes or picture element for adaptive image loading

subtasks.title: Adjust typography for readability across devices
subtasks.description: Ensure text is legible and properly scaled on all screen sizes
subtasks.details: Implement fluid typography using viewport units or media queries

subtasks.title: Develop responsive form layouts
subtasks.description: Create forms that adjust layout and input sizes for different devices
subtasks.details: Stack form elements vertically on mobile and use multi-column layouts on larger screens

subtasks.title: Implement responsive data tables
subtasks.description: Design tables that can be easily read and navigated on small screens
subtasks.details: Use techniques like horizontal scrolling, collapsing columns, or card-based layouts for mobile

subtasks.title: Conduct cross-device testing
subtasks.description: Test the responsive design implementation across various devices and browsers
subtasks.details: Use both physical devices and emulators to verify layout, functionality, and performance

tasks.title: Set Up Continuous Deployment with Vercel and GitHub
tasks.description: Configure automatic deployment using Vercel and GitHub integration.
tasks.details: Create a GitHub repository for the project. Configure Vercel for automatic deployments from the GitHub repository. Set up environment variables in Vercel dashboard. Configure build settings and deployment branches.
tasks.testStrategy: Make a test commit and push to GitHub to verify automatic deployment. Check that environment variables are correctly set in the deployed application.

subtasks.title: Create GitHub Repository
subtasks.description: Set up a new GitHub repository for the project
subtasks.details: Initialize a new repository on GitHub, add a README.md file, and set up appropriate .gitignore file

subtasks.title: Configure Vercel Account
subtasks.description: Set up and configure a Vercel account for deployments
subtasks.details: Create a Vercel account if not existing, and familiarize with the Vercel dashboard

subtasks.title: Link GitHub to Vercel
subtasks.description: Connect the GitHub repository to Vercel for automatic deployments
subtasks.details: Use Vercel's GitHub integration to link the repository and set up automatic deployment triggers

subtasks.title: Configure Environment Variables
subtasks.description: Set up necessary environment variables in Vercel
subtasks.details: Identify required environment variables and add them to the Vercel project settings

subtasks.title: Test Automatic Deployment
subtasks.description: Verify that changes pushed to GitHub trigger automatic deployments on Vercel
subtasks.details: Make a small change in the repository, push to GitHub, and confirm that Vercel automatically deploys the changes

tasks.title: Conduct Final Testing and Bug Fixes
tasks.description: Perform comprehensive testing of all features and fix any identified bugs.
tasks.details: Create a test plan covering all implemented features. Conduct thorough testing of all user flows, including edge cases. Test admin functionalities with different permission levels. Verify data consistency between the frontend and the Supabase database. Address and fix any bugs or issues discovered during testing.
tasks.testStrategy: Execute the test plan and document any issues found. Perform cross-browser testing. Conduct user acceptance testing with stakeholders. Verify that all fixed issues are resolved in the production environment.

subtasks.title: Define test plan and scope
subtasks.description: Create a comprehensive test plan outlining the scope, objectives, and methodologies for testing all features
subtasks.details: Include timelines, resources, and specific testing environments in the plan

subtasks.title: Develop test cases for core features
subtasks.description: Create detailed test cases for all core features of the application
subtasks.details: Ensure coverage of positive and negative scenarios, input validation, and expected outputs

subtasks.title: Identify and document edge cases
subtasks.description: Analyze each feature to identify potential edge cases and create specific test scenarios
subtasks.details: Consider extreme inputs, boundary conditions, and unexpected user behaviors

subtasks.title: Set up cross-browser testing environment
subtasks.description: Prepare testing environments for multiple browsers and versions
subtasks.details: Include popular browsers like Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge, as well as their mobile versions

subtasks.title: Execute cross-browser compatibility tests
subtasks.description: Run test cases across different browsers to ensure consistent functionality and appearance
subtasks.details: Document any discrepancies or issues found during cross-browser testing

subtasks.title: Perform responsive design testing
subtasks.description: Test the application's responsiveness across various screen sizes and devices
subtasks.details: Use both real devices and emulators to cover a wide range of screen sizes and resolutions

subtasks.title: Conduct performance testing
subtasks.description: Evaluate the application's performance under different load conditions
subtasks.details: Use tools to simulate various user loads and measure response times, resource usage, and stability

subtasks.title: Prepare user acceptance testing (UAT) scenarios
subtasks.description: Develop a set of real-world scenarios for user acceptance testing
subtasks.details: Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure scenarios cover critical business processes

subtasks.title: Conduct user acceptance testing
subtasks.description: Facilitate UAT sessions with end-users or stakeholders
subtasks.details: Gather feedback, document issues, and prioritize any necessary changes or fixes

subtasks.title: Compile and analyze test results
subtasks.description: Collect all test results, analyze findings, and prepare a comprehensive test report
subtasks.details: Summarize test coverage, identified issues, and recommendations for improvements or fixes
